meanings.definition: The action of drawing or pulling something over a surface.
meanings.sent1: The tractor gained traction as it pulled the heavy load.
meanings.sent2: The sled moved smoothly over the snow with good traction.
meanings.sent3: The toy car struggled for traction on the slippery floor.
meanings.sent4: Her speech gained traction with the audience, drawing them in.
meanings.sent5: The sticky tape provided excellent traction for the papers on the desk.

meanings.definition: The extent to which an idea or product gains popularity or acceptance.
meanings.sent1: The new song quickly gained traction and became a hit.
meanings.sent2: The social media post got a lot of traction from users.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a pet rock gained unexpected traction in the market.
meanings.sent4: Her fashion line gained traction among young adults.
meanings.sent5: The viral video gained traction across various platforms.

meanings.definition: The adhesive friction of a body on a surface.
meanings.sent1: The shoes had good traction on the wet pavement.
meanings.sent2: The tires of the car provided excellent traction on the road.
meanings.sent3: The sticky note lost its traction and fell off the wall.
meanings.sent4: The athlete's cleats gave him great traction on the field.
meanings.sent5: The velcro had strong traction, keeping the bag securely closed.
